intro: Pourthiaea moiorum, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in well-drained soil. It produces an underground bulb that stores nutrients for the next growing season. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
